'''Easton Press''' is a publishing company that sells luxury editions of famous books. Wrapped in genuine leather and 22kt gold, their books are collector's editions.

==Publications==
* ''J.R.R. Tolkien's Lost Tales of Middle-earth'', a collection of: 
** ''[[The Book of Lost Tales Part One]]''
** ''[[The Book of Lost Tales Part Two]]''
** ''[[Unfinished Tales]]''
* ''[[The Children of Húrin]]''
* ''[[The Legend of Sigurd and Gudrun]]''
* ''[[Tales from the Perilous Realm]]''
* ''[[The Father Christmas Letters]]''
*''Tolkien Classics'', a collection of:
** ''[[The Hobbit]]''
** ''[[The Silmarillion]]''
** ''[[The Fellowship of the Ring]]''
** ''[[The Two Towers]]''
** ''[[The Return of the King]]''
* ''The Lord of the Rings Visual Companions'', a collection of: 
**''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring Visual Companion|The Fellowship of the Ring Visual Companion]]'' by [[Jude Fisher]]
**''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers Visual Companion|The Two Towers Visual Companion]]'' by Jude Fisher
**''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King Visual Companion|The Return of the King Visual Companion]]'' by Jude Fisher
* ''[[The Atlas of Middle-Earth]]'' by Karen Wynn Fonstad
* ''[[The Complete Guide to Middle-earth]]'' by Robert Foster
* ''[[The Fall of Arthur]]
* ''[[The History of The Lord of the Rings]]''
** ''[[The Return of the Shadow]]''
** ''[[The Treason of Isengard]]''
** ''[[The War of the Ring]]''
**'' [[The End of the Third Age]]''
* ''[[The Making of Middle-earth]]''
* ''[[Beowulf]]''
* ''[[The Story of Kullervo]]''
* ''[[The Lay of Aotrou and Itroun]]''
* ''[[Beren and Luthien]]''
* ''[[The Lays of Beleriand]]''
* ''[[The Art of The Lord of the Rings]]''
* ''[[The Fall of Gondolin]]''
* ''[[Sir Gawain and the Green Knight]]'' / ''[[Pearl]]'' / ''[[Sir Orfeo]]''
* ''[[Morgoth's Ring]]'' and ''[[The War of the Jewels]]''
* ''[[The Shaping of Middle-earth]]''
* ''[[The Lost Road and Other Writings]]''
* ''[[The Peoples of Middle-Earth]]''
* ''[[The Illustrated World of Tolkien]]'' by [[David Day]]
* ''[[The Worlds of J.R.R. Tolkien]]'' by [[John Garth]]
* ''[[The Ring Legends of Tolkien]]'''' by [[David Day]]
